content.question: Assume a decreasing-cost perfectly competitive industry. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: Firms will earn economic profits in long-run equilibrium.
The short-run market supply curve is upward sloping; the long-run supply curve is horizontal or perfectly elastic.
As industry output expands, there are fewer firms producing in the long run.
As industry output contracts, each firm’s long-run average total cost curve shifts upward.
Input prices rise as the industry produces more output.

content.answer: As industry output contracts, each firm’s long-run average total cost curve shifts upward.
